data.title: Building captured notification CnC
data.body: Whenever you capture a building in CnC whether its neutral or not you get the notification "GDI building Captured" (as nod). We should change this so that it says "Building Captured" when capturing a civilian building.

data.title: Infantry can enter enemy APC after diplomacy change
data.body:
Bug report: diplomacy

Version: 20131223
mod: red alert
units\Buildings involved: rifle man,apc
map: forest path
side: soviet
situation : game started with diplomacy on
2 players 1-Hard AI 1-human same team. after changing the team to "enemy status" and after that re changing the diplomacy to "ally status" (human player part,the ai was still enemy) the infantry was able to enter on ENEMY "AI"  apc.

data.title: More speeches polishing
data.body:
If you click in a supportpower-widget while it's providing building is powered down, nothing happens at all.
I changed this so the "insufficient power"-speeches are played in this case, for RA and C&C.
Also added the corresponding entry to the yaml files.

Pls review the code first.

data.title: Garrisonable trait
data.body: Add a trait that allows units to garrison other units and use their weapons within the garrisoned unit

data.title: OpenRA.Mods.RA.Air.FlyAttack causes the activity queue to be discarded
data.body:
In the following sequence, the last line won't have any effect:

Actor.Fly(someplane, waypointA.CenterPosition)
Actor.FlyAttackActor(someplane, sometarget)
Actor.Fly(someplane, waypointB.CenterPosition)

The reason is that the activity queued in the last line will be discarded when one of two conditions in OpenRA.Mods.RA.Air.FlyAttack occur:
1) the plane runs out of ammo
2) the target is destroyed

Of course, one of these always occurs (unless the aircraft is destroyed, but then it's a moot point anyway).

I think the proper solution would be to not cancel the whole queue but just the current activity. If there is no next activity, the aircraft becomes idle and ReturnOnIdle is invoked.

Unfortunately I don't have any C# skills, so I can't fix this myself :/

The issue isn't terribly critical, since it can be worked around with some delays and Actor.Stop, but the behaviour is counter-intuitive and the workaround is cumbersome.

data.title: Fix build of Debian package
data.body:
I'm new to the whole github thing, so I want to start of with something small and simple:

The build of the Debian package had some issues:
- AUTHORS, CHANGELOG and COPYRIGHT files were placed in /usr/lib/openra
- /usr/share/doc/openra/changelog.gz did not contain the changelog, because the script contained the wrong path to the CHANGELOG file
- Due to the above, the build failed on my system and I was not able to build a .deb

I fixed that by placing AUTHORS and CHANGELOG in /usr/share/doc/openra and removing the COPYRIGHT file (the license texts are located in /usr/share/common-licences on Debian-based systems).  The build now also finishes successfully on my system.

data.title: Set up project files for the MonoDevelop LuaBinding
data.body:
http://addins.monodevelop.com/Project/Index/98 is a nice help because of syntax highlighting, code completion and having one IDE to edit the whole project including missions.

![monodevelop-luabinding](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/756669/1949236/8285a030-80f3-11e3-9449-bd699e37fb94.png)

Note: this requires a .lua filename policy change as having multiple "mission.lua" is not helpful in a project tree.

data.title: Disables "building"-speech when nothing more can be built
data.body:
Small polishing:

When you try to buid something and it's build-limit has already been reached (like 2nd tanya ore nuke silo), it plays both the "building"- and the "unable to build more"-speeches.

It should only play the latter speech in this case.

data.title: Fixed missing Requires: freetype2 for Fedora
data.body: This reverts https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4305. While this works on clean VMs that build proper RPMs from source in the same environment where it will be installed later the `0%{?fedora}` or `0%{?suse}` RPM macros will always be zero on our Ubuntu build server which also feature a very old and hacked version of rpmbuild. I should have known that this will be a problem. Sorry.

data.title: Fix unit attack pathing
data.body:
This improves pathfinding in a bunch of cases relating to attacks: 
- Fixes #2104, #2923, #4449, #4455.
- Helicopters and planes can now Guard and Follow other actors (C&C only - requires AutoTargeting aircraft).
- Cleans up a bunch of crufty old code.

This will need a fair bit more testing, as it is fiddly code with a bunch of potential edge-cases.

data.title: [KOTH/New gamemode]: Multiple strategic points
data.body:
It would be interesting to have a KOTH mode with multiple strategic points, e.g. 

-- the timer countdown speed could be proportional to m/n, with m being the number of captured strategic points and n the number of strategic points on the map.

data.title: [KOTH] Gameplay fix needed
data.body:
Hi, 

currently, the counter is reset to zero when one party enters the contested KOTH strategic area.

This can be exploited by calling a paradrop or simply send a chooper/Yak to the contested area. Once the airplane is shot down, the remaining paratroops will land and remain alive long (or short :-) enough reset the counter.

Proposed Fix: all troops of the occupying faction in the strategic area need to be wiped out before a counter reset and takeover can happen.

data.title: rpm packages are still broken for fedora linux
data.body:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/f1372acf3fc200740152ea8ba26b89b74d745ea1/packaging/linux/rpm/openra.spec#L16

This check still fails for Fedora and returns 'freetype2', so users can't install OpenRA using rpm package.

data.title: Add AttackMove to C&C helicopters
data.body:
This tidies up AttackMove to work for any actor that implements IMove. Actors that don't implement AutoTarget will perform a normal move order, which makes the JustMove parameter redundant.

The RA aircraft don't AutoTarget, so won't benefit from these changes.

data.title: No shrapnel in Dune2000
data.body: Shrapnel was a feature that I enjoyed about D2k. It is currently missing, and I am working on it :p

data.title: Spiceblooms
data.body: Dune2000 is currently missing "spice blooms", which is an important part of the game. I am currently working on it.

data.title: fix client join/leave race with master server ping
Server: Can't add bots to the slot with another client
data.body:
Maybe a bit difficult to reproduce.
You have to click "Add bots" in Slot Admin while someone is joining server but has not joined yet.

data.title: frequent pings to master servers cause an exception in master server code on some servers
data.body:
In lobby you get "Master server communication failed" and next is dumped into server.log: 
Non-blocking send of 4 bytes failed. Falling back to blocking send.
System.InvalidOperationException: Collection was modified; enumeration operation may not execute.
  at System.Collections.Generic.List`1+Enumerator[OpenRA.Network.Session+Client].MoveNext () [0x00000] in :0 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable+c__Iterator1D`1[OpenRA.Network.Session+Client].MoveNext () [0x00000] in :0 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable.Count[Client] (IEnumerable`1 source) [0x00000] in :0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Server.MasterServerPinger+c__AnonStorey89.<>m__9B () [0x00000] in :0
A way to reproduce: quickly Add and Remove bots in Lobby over Slot Admin. Can't reproduce on all servers; on some servers it takes time to reproduce it; but if you do it on hetzner servers you will get a result really quick. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/a8a5a88e8f6a7b6aa63b696dc2b7c8693b600748/OpenRA.Mods.RA/ServerTraits/MasterServerPinger.cs#L82

data.title: Line damage projectile
data.body: There is no line damage yet, making disruptors, railguns and sonic tanks practically useless.
